sense.name: affected manners, putting on a pretense
sense.examples: The woman dropped her pose of amiability and glared at the waiter. Everyone found John's pose of superior upbringing to be quite ridiculous. His pose of being a dot-com entrepreneur didn't fool anyone at the party.

sense.name: intentional physical stance, often for artistic purpose
sense.examples: The models struck different poses in their bathing suits for the fashion shoot. In Mary's art class, they sketched a nude in a reclining pose. These are advanced ballet poses, too difficult for beginners. We looked at photos of boxers in ferocious poses.
